instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2251: What is A2251? A2251 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2020 with EMC 3348, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01949..
definitions.820-01949: What is 820-01949? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_PCH_PWROK: What is PM_PCH_PWROK? PM_PCH_PWROK is usually created by U1950, a 74LVC2G08GT chip and is necessary for the machine to wake from an S5 and S4 state and turn on. This signal will be present if ALL_SYS_PWRGD, CPU_VR_PGOOD, PP3V3_S0, and PP3V42_G3H are present. When this signal is not present or intermittent, usually pin 8 on U1950 for PP3V42_G3H is corroded..
definitions.PLT_RST_L: What is PLT_RST_L? This is an abbreviation of “PLT_RESET_L” – when you see “PLT_RST_L", assume the person meant to type PLT_RESET_L.
definitions.PM_SYSRST_L: What is PM_SYSRST_L? PM_SYSRST_L is a system reset signal present when it is low, _L means the signal asserts itself when the voltage is low. This signal needs to be high for the system to exit reset mode & turn on properly. .
definitions.RSMRST_L: What is RSMRST_L? RSMRST_L is an abbreviation of PM_RSMRST_L.

threads.title: MacbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07  No Internal and External display
threads.message:
Hi
Got an 2020 macbook with no display. checked with external display but no luck.
there is a usb activity, i can see led light in a usb mouse. No Caps lock light.

CPU getting warm and stucked at 200mAmp. Some time goes to 950mAmp when startup but return back and stayes at 200mAMP

<SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> -1.8V
PM-<SIGNAL>RSMRST_L</SIGNAL>- 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PM_SYSRST_L</SIGNAL>- 3.3 V
<SIGNAL>PPVCCIN_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>- 1.6V
<SIGNAL>VCCST_PWRGD</SIGNAL>- 1V
<SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL>- 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PM_PCH_PWROK</SIGNAL>- 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PM_PCH_DPWROK</SIGNAL>-3.3V
<SIGNAL>PPVCCIN_AUX_PCH_PRIM</SIGNAL>- 1.8 V

No idea where i can start for. looks like it is not booting properly.

threads.title: MacbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2251</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07  No Internal and External display
threads.message:
Steady light on mouse is not a sign for USB activity.
You should know that; was already explained on the forum.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]

Did you try DFU?
